lines.text: The graph of a normal distribution
Use rectangles to estimate area under curve
Area of bar = probability of outcome
Multiply probability by width of bar

secText:
1. What is a normal distribution?
2. How can one assess the probability of an outcome in normally distributed data?

Enduring Understandings :
1. The graph of normally distributed data is a bell-shaped curve. Real-world phenomena often is normally distributed.
2. The probability of an outcome can be calculated using the methods outlined in the text.

STEM Skills:
1. Discuss with your instructor labs in which your data may be normally distributed.
